abstract: The Jets lost to the Ravens, but their game on NBC made the network a ratings winner. CBS was second on the night.
snippet: The Jets lost to the Ravens, but their game on NBC made the network a ratings winner. CBS was second on the night.
lead_paragraph: For one night of the week at least, NBC has little to worry about regarding its broadcast schedule: the National Football League continues to save the network from what has so far been a dismal fall season. The Baltimore Ravens defeated the Jets, 34-17, on "Sunday Night Football" to give NBC a ratings win in all viewership categories. Final audience numbers were not available on Monday afternoon. CBS finished second over all with new episodes of "The Amazing Race" and "The Good Wife," though the numbers were skewed higher because of N.F.L. coverage overruns across the country. On ABC, "Pan Am" quickly lost altitude; it averaged 7.75 million total viewers in its second week, down more than 3 million from the series premiere.

headline.main: N.F.L. Carries NBC in Sunday Night Ratings
